trans-unit.source: Represents a text decoration, which a visual ornamentation that is added to text (such as an underline).
There are four types of text decorations: underline, baseline, strikethrough, and overline.
The following example shows the locations of the text decorations relative to the text.

![Diagram of text decoration locations](~/add/media/textdecoration01.gif "Diagram of text decoration locations") Example of text decoration types The following example shows a text decoration that has been styled with a linear gradient brush and a dashed pen.

![Text decoration with linear gradient underline](~/add/media/textdecoration02.png "Text decoration with linear gradient underline") Example of an underline styled with a linear gradient brush and dashed pen Notice that TextDecoration is derived from <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable>.

This makes it possible to apply animated effects to the decoration elements, using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimation> for the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset%2A> and a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ThicknessAnimation> for the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecoration"></xref> class.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Location%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.TextDecorationLocation>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecoration"></xref> class with the specified <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*>, <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen*>, <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset*>, <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffsetUnit*>, and <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenThicknessUnit*> values.
The location of the text decoration.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Pen"></xref> used to draw the text decoration.

If this value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the text decoration color matches the text color to which it is applied, and the text decoration's thickness is set to the font's recommended thickness.
The vertical displacement from the text decoration's location.
A negative value moves the decoration lower, while a positive value moves the decoration higher.
The units used to interpret the value of `penOffset`.
The units used to interpret the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness*> for the `pen`.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecoration"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecoration"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets or sets the vertical location at which the text decoration is drawn.
The following example shows the locations of the text decorations relative to the text.

![Diagram of text decoration locations](~/add/media/textdecoration01.gif "Diagram of text decoration locations") Example of text decoration types The <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset%2A> property enables you to offset the text decoration from the specified Location.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The vertical location at which the text decoration is drawn.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Pen"></xref> used to draw the text decoration.
The following example shows a text decoration that has been styled with a linear gradient brush and a dashed pen.

![Text decoration with linear gradient underline](~/add/media/textdecoration02.png "Text decoration with linear gradient underline") Example of an underline styled with a linear gradient brush and dashed pen ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Pen"></xref> used to draw the text decoration.
If this value is `null`, the decoration color matches the text to which it is applied and the decoration's thickness is set to the font's recommended thickness.
Gets or sets the text decoration's offset from its <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*>.
A negative value moves the text decoration higher, while a positive value moves the text decoration lower.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffsetUnit%2A> property to specify how the units of this value are interpreted.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The text decoration's offset from its <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Location*>.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the units in which the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset*> value is expressed.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The units in which the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffset*> value is expressed.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationUnit"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenOffsetUnit*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the units in which the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness*> of the text decoration's <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen*> is expressed.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The units in which the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness*> of the text decoration's <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.Pen*> is expressed.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.TextDecorationUnit"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.TextDecoration.PenThicknessUnit*> dependency property.
To be added.
